title: az network bastion rdp does not work for IP-based connection

labels.name: bug
labels.description: This issue requires a change to an existing behavior in the product in order to be resolved.

labels.name: customer-reported
labels.description: Issues that are reported by GitHub users external to the Azure organization.

labels.name: Service Attention
labels.description: This issue is responsible by Azure service team.

labels.name: Client
labels.description: This issue points to a problem in the data-plane of the library.

body:
<!--- 🛑 Please check existing issues first before continuing: https://github.com/Azure/azure-cli/issues --->

## Describe the bug
Since last few days , we are experiencing issues with RDP connection to Azure VMs using `az network bastion rdp` **IP-Based** command. Few of our observations below - 
- the operation fails in few regions, so far we have tested Canadeast , Canada Central and West Europe. 
- the command/operation works fine using `--target-resource-id` parameter irrespective of the region
- IP based connection using "Connect" option  from the Bastion blade in the portal works fine.

**Command Name**
`az network bastion rdp
Extension Name: bastion. Version: 0.2.3.`

**Errors:**
```
While the command does not display any error but I occasionally I get "An Internal Error Occured" dialogue box once the requested RDP connection fails or sometimes the "Remote Desktop Connection" keeps connecting without any error, post cancellation we get 
**[WinError 10054] An existing connection was forcibly closed by the remote host** only when we run the command with `--debug` flag.


```

## To Reproduce:
Steps to reproduce the behavior. Note that argument values have been redacted, as they may contain sensitive information.

Bastion resource should be deployed in Canada East region

- `az network bastion rdp --name {} --resource-group {} --target-ip-address {} ` 
or
- `az network bastion rdp --name {} --resource-group {} --target-ip-address {} --debug`

## Expected Behavior

Upon successful completion of the command and remote desktop connection, we should get login prompt to enter our username and password for the VM to login. 

## Environment Summary
```
Windows-10-10.0.19045-SP0
Python 3.10.10
Installer: MSI

azure-cli 2.46.0

Extensions:
account 0.2.1
bastion 0.2.3
interactive 0.4.5

Dependencies:
msal 1.20.0
azure-mgmt-resource 21.1.0b1
```
## Additional Context
if this helps
msal.telemetry: Generate or reuse correlation_id: b6398262-da94-419a-8a72-196b25642623

title: az k8s-extension create in 1.3.8 removes support for --configuration-protected-settings - breaks docs and automation

labels.name: bug
labels.description: This issue requires a change to an existing behavior in the product in order to be resolved.

labels.name: CXP Attention
labels.description: This issue is handled by CXP team.

labels.name: issue-addressed
labels.description: This issue is addressed and ready to close.

body:
- If the issue is to do with Azure CLI 2.0 in-particular, create an issue here at [Azure/azure-cli](https://github.com/Azure/azure-cli/issues)

### Related command
<!--- Please provide the related command with az {command} if you can, so that we can quickly route to the related team for help. --->

az k8s-extension create \
    --resource-group $GROUP_NAME \
    --name $EXTENSION_NAME \
    --cluster-type connectedClusters \
    --cluster-name $CLUSTER_NAME \
    --extension-type 'Microsoft.App.Environment' \
    --release-train stable \
    --auto-upgrade-minor-version true \
    --scope cluster \
    --release-namespace $NAMESPACE \
    --configuration-settings "Microsoft.CustomLocation.ServiceAccount=default" \
    --configuration-settings "appsNamespace=${NAMESPACE}" \
    --configuration-settings "CLUSTER_NAME=${CONNECTED_ENVIRONMENT_NAME}" \
    --configuration-settings "envoy.annotations.service.beta.kubernetes.io/azure-load-balancer-resource-group=${AKS_CLUSTER_GROUP_NAME}" \
    --configuration-settings "logProcessor.appLogs.destination=log-analytics" \
    --**configuration-protected-settings** "logProcessor.appLogs.logAnalyticsConfig.customerId=${LOG_ANALYTICS_WORKSPACE_ID_ENC}" \
    --**configuration-protected-settings** "logProcessor.appLogs.logAnalyticsConfig.sharedKey=${lOG_ANALYTICS_KEY_ENC}"

### Extension name (the extension in question)

k8s-extension (Arc enabled Kubernetes Extensions)

### Description of issue (in as much detail as possible)

As of k8s-extension CLI Extension v1.3.8 it appears the ability to pass protected configuration settings using --configuration-protected-settings has been dropped without warning.  All of the Application services (Web, Function, Logic Apps), Container Apps on Arc extension documentation uses this property.  This command is successful in 1.3.7 and there is no notification of removal of support in a future version.  This also breaks automation.

This is a breaking change and is causing issues.

-----

title: k8s-extension 1.3.8 no longer supports --configuration-protected-settings-file

labels.name: bug
labels.description: This issue requires a change to an existing behavior in the product in order to be resolved.

labels.name: Service Attention
labels.description: This issue is responsible by Azure service team.

labels.name: issue-addressed
labels.description: This issue is addressed and ready to close.

body:
### Related command
az k8s-extension create 

### Extension name (the extension in question)
k8s-extension

### Description of issue (in as much detail as possible)
It appears that a change was introduced in 1.3.8 of k8s-extension wherein "--configuration-protected-settings-file" is no longer supported for passing protected config via a file. Rather, only "--config-protected-file" and "--protected-settings-file" work now. I browsed for release notes but didn't see a mention of this. Was the change intentional?

Noticed that: "--configuration-settings-file" is in the same boat.

-----

title: Image Copy '--target-subscription' Argument Ignored

labels.name: bug
labels.description: This issue requires a change to an existing behavior in the product in order to be resolved.

labels.name: customer-reported
labels.description: Issues that are reported by GitHub users external to the Azure organization.

labels.name: Azure CLI Team
labels.description: The command of the issue is owned by Azure CLI team

body:
### Related command
<!--- Please provide the related command with az {command} if you can, so that we can quickly route to the related team for help. --->
```bash
az image copy --source-resource-group <source_rg_name> \
        --source-object-name <source_image_name> \
        --source-type image \
        --target-subscription <target_subscription_id> \
        --target-location <target_location> \
        --target-resource-group <target_rg_name>  \
        --target-name <target_image_name> \
        --temporary-resource-group-name <temp_rg_name>
```

### Extension name (the extension in question)
image-copy-extension

### Description of issue (in as much detail as possible)

My organization is using the `image-copy-extension` and we noticed on recent workflows that the extension is now ignoring the `--target-subscription` argument and seems to use the authentication context subscription as the target subscription for all temporary resource and final image creation instead.

We noticed this change because previously the temporary resource group we used was stored within the target subscription and this meant that the temporary storage account, blob, and snapshot all got created within this temporary resource group but now the extension seems to be looking for the temporary resource group in the default subscription associated with the authentication context instead of the target subscription provided to the `--target-subscription` argument.

My Python experience is still limited but I have looked at the [recent commit](https://github.com/Azure/azure-cli-extensions/commit/3a6621cc0c96aab5ddd2388f4a2e6a81f4ed2f0a) and I see that the `target_subscription` variable is now being set without checking if the argument has been passed and I'm not sure if this was changed for a reason or if this is just a bug that can be fixed by only setting the `target_subscription` variable if the argument is null.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/20447447/209253966-f9129522-3988-4c73-9abc-d6fc0e7ef991.png)

Link to the line in question.

https://github.com/Azure/azure-cli-extensions/blob/42102c3a81ad23407e7d929521ea212805b4688d/src/image-copy/azext_imagecopy/custom.py#L37

There is also a debug line below the variable declaration that we've seen continues to display the subscription ID for the authentication context and not the target subscription we're providing as an argument.

-----

body:
### Related command
az ml workspace sync-keys --name
                          --resource-group

from your documentation here: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/cli/azure/ml/workspace?view=azure-cli-latest#az-ml-workspace-sync-keys

the command from above is not working anymore. Here is the error we receive:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/39839482/200276182-4fdf23cb-a79f-49c0-b555-1b173a0ef839.png)

labels.name: bug

body:
---

This checklist is used to make sure that common guidelines for a pull request are followed.

Fixed the model compatibility issue caused by the recent [rebranding](https://github.com/Azure/azure-rest-api-specs/pull/19172) of Microsoft Defender when updating defender-related configurations through `aks create/update` commands in aks-preview. Would release a new version (**0.5.91**) of aks-preview.

**Notice**
The breaking change on this model is in effect in the **preview API** (corresponding to aks-preview) since [2022-05-02-preview](https://github.com/Azure/azure-rest-api-specs/pull/19172). 

In **stable API** (corresponding to azure-cli, without the extension aks-preview), the breaking change on this model will take effect from [2022-06-01](https://github.com/Azure/azure-rest-api-specs/pull/19665)

Fix issue [#5090](https://github.com/Azure/azure-cli-extensions/issues/5090), [#5092](https://github.com/Azure/azure-cli-extensions/issues/5092).

title: {AKS} Fix enabled virtual node addon showing wrong status in `aks addon list`

labels.name: bug
labels.description: This issue requires a change to an existing behavior in the product in order to be resolved.

body:
fixes Azure/azure-cli-extensions#5098

az aks addon list command always returns "enable:false" for virtual-node addon. REST API returns "enable:true", but CLI displays result as "enable:false"

```
az aks addon list -g TestRG -n TestCluster --debug
# REST API returns the addon status to be "enabled:true" in debug trace.
   "addonProfiles": {
    "aciConnectorLinux": {
     "enabled": true,            <<<<<<<
     "config": {
      "SubnetName": "VirtualNodeSubnet"
     },


#However, CLI displays "enabled:false". It appears to be matching with "aciConnector" instead of "aciConnectorLinux".

  {
    "api_key": "aciConnector",
    "enabled": false,           <<<<<<<<<
    "name": "virtual-node"
  },
```

As per [this](https://github.com/Azure/azure-cli-extensions/blob/b02803b4bd7aee2ae9e707af1be8b6a9860559a7/src/aks-preview/azext_aks_preview/addonconfiguration.py#L107) and [this](https://github.com/Azure/azure-cli-extensions/blob/b02803b4bd7aee2ae9e707af1be8b6a9860559a7/src/aks-preview/azext_aks_preview/custom.py#L1667
)  source code we see that Linux is appended to the VirtualNode addon, so this check should be done while listing the addon:

```
os_type = 'Linux'
enable_virtual_node = False
if CONST_VIRTUAL_NODE_ADDON_NAME + os_type in instance.addon_profiles:
        enable_virtual_node = True
```

```
        addon = ADDONS[addon_arg]
        if addon == CONST_VIRTUAL_NODE_ADDON_NAME:
            # only linux is supported for now, in the future this will be a user flag
            addon += os_type
```

title: Improve handling of SSH fingerprints

labels.name: bug
labels.description: This issue requires a change to an existing behavior in the product in order to be resolved.

labels.name: customer-reported
labels.description: Issues that are reported by GitHub users external to the Azure organization.

labels.name: CXP Attention
labels.description: This issue is handled by CXP team.

body:
### Extension name (the extension in question)
SSH

### Description of issue (in as much detail as possible)
If a Azure Virtual Machine is rebuilt (after having already used Az SSH VM to connect to it and accept the fingerprint) and then try and connect to it again, the AZ CLI won't do anything, doesn't present any errors just returns to the command prompt.

Putty (using local username and password) can still connect to the VM perfectly fine in this scenario.

If I delete the C:\Users\<user>\.ssh folder and then try reconnecting to the same Azure VM it will ask me to accept the fingerprint and it then connects fine.
-----

When deploying a model with `az ml deploy` I get an MemoryError. Full relevant debug output can be found [here](https://gist.github.com/oottka/d38163b31a5a672df0cd418ef0a13f1a).

Steps to reproduce:

1) In a python console, run

```python
import torch
model = torch.hub.load('pytorch/vision:v0.9.0', 'resnet101', pretrained=True)
```

2) `az ml model register --n resnet101_pytorch -p <path-to-downloaded-resnet-pth-file>`
3) `az ml model deploy --debug --verbose -n resnet101service -m resnet101_pytorch:1 --overwrite --ic simpleinferencingconfiguration.json --dc deploymentconfig.json`
4) The command results in `{'Azure-cli-ml Version': '1.28.0', 'Error': MemoryError()}`

The configuration files can be found [here](https://gist.github.com/oottka/d38163b31a5a672df0cd418ef0a13f1a).

Environment:

Tested on Windows 10, Docker 20.10.6, WSL2 Docker backend,

```az --version
azure-cli                         2.23.0

core                              2.23.0
telemetry                          1.0.6

Extensions:
azure-cli-ml                      1.28.0
```

Also tested on Ubuntu 20.04 inside WSL2, Docker 19.03.8, with same results.

At no point during execution is RAM usage exceptionally high or near the RAM capacity.

-----

title: Extension online docs are not reflecting CLI parameter metadata.

labels.name: bug
labels.description: This issue requires a change to an existing behavior in the product in order to be resolved.

body:
The docs for `az network firewall ip-config create` are mismatched.

Docs: `az network firewall ip-config create` list `--subnet` as a valid command.

CLI:

```
mike@Azure:~$ az network firewall ip-config create -h
This command is from the following extension: azure-firewall
The extension is in preview

Command
    az network firewall ip-config create : Create an Azure Firewall IP configuration.

Arguments
    --firewall-name -f  [Required] : Azure Firewall name.
    --name -n           [Required] : Name of the IP configuration.
    --public-ip-address [Required] : Name or ID of the public IP to use.
    --resource-group -g [Required] : Name of resource group. You can configure the default group
                                     using `az configure --defaults group=<name>`.
    --vnet-name         [Required] : The virtual network (VNet) name.
    --private-ip-address           : IP address used by the Firewall ILB as the next hop in User
                                     Defined Routes.

Global Arguments
    --debug                        : Increase logging verbosity to show all debug logs.
    --help -h                      : Show this help message and exit.
    --output -o                    : Output format.  Allowed values: json, jsonc, none, table, tsv,
                                     yaml.  Default: json.
    --query                        : JMESPath query string. See http://jmespath.org/ for more
                                     information and examples.
    --subscription                 : Name or ID of subscription. You can configure the default
                                     subscription using `az account set -s NAME_OR_ID`.
    --verbose                      : Increase logging verbosity. Use --debug for full debug logs
```

If you try and leverage the `--subnet` flag, you get this error:

```
mike@Azure:~$ az network firewall ip-config create -f <fw> --name <name> --vnet-name <vnet> --public-ip-address <pip> --private-ip-address 10.0.0.9 -g <rg> --subnet <snet>
Resource /subscriptions/.../resourceGroups/<rg>/providers/Microsoft.Network/virtualNetworks/<vnet>/subnets/<snet> referenced by resource /subscriptions/.../resourceGroups/<rg>/providers/Microsoft.Network/azureFirewalls/<fw> was not found. Please make sure that the referenced resource exists, and that both resources are in the same region.
```

Both resources are in the same resource group in the same region.
